Basic Tools
A basic repair toolkit comprising various pliers, screws, adhesives, and assorted fasteners. This kit is designed for fundamental repair tasks but lacks the precision tools required for advanced maintenance. With sufficient knowledge and experience, it can be employed in the creation of enhanced equipment. The components show signs of light use.

Advanced Tools
An advanced set of tools including small pliers, tipped tweezers, and a probe and pick set. This kit is well-suited for more intricate repair and crafting tasks. Despite its capability, the user must possess considerable skill to fully utilize its potential. The tools are in a moderately used condition.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] workshop item

Expert Tools
A professional set of high-quality tools designed for fine-tuning and detailed repair work. Contains a drill bit set, precision tweezers, soldering iron, 4mm screwdriver bits, and a multimeter. These tools are essential for advanced equipment creation and modification, demanding a high level of expertise from the user. The set shows signs of heavy use but remains functional.

Drug-Making Kit
A compact case containing plastic packages, tablets, and ampoules for drug production and management. It includes the basic components necessary for crafting medicinal and chemical solutions. The effectiveness of this kit depends on the user's medical knowledge and access to suitable materials. The kit has been lightly used, with some components nearing expiration.

Gunsmithing Tools
A comprehensive set of gunsmithing tools, including a pin punch set, wheeler hammer, press tool, and a black powder measure kit. This kit allows for the recycling of damaged ammunition and the creation of custom rounds. To achieve optimal results, significant gunsmithing knowledge and experience are required. The tools show moderate wear and tear from extensive use.

Binoculars
A pair of standard issue military binoculars. The model is designed for reconnaissance missions, offering exceptional clarity and durability. The rubberized coating ensures a firm grip even in harsh weather conditions. The lenses are multi-coated to reduce glare and enhance image quality. They are built with a variable zoom functionality to allow for comfortable observation from a safe distance.

 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] variable zoom

Grooming Kit
A compact nylon travel case containing essential grooming tools. This kit includes a beard and moustache comb, facial scissors with ultra-sharp stainless steel blades, and a precision trimming tip. The scissors' design ensures precise cuts, while the comb helps maintain a neat appearance even in the rugged conditions of the Zone. While primarily for personal care, the tools can also serve as makeshift disassembling tools in a pinch.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] workshop item
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] disassembly tool

Pack of Throwables
A small pack holding a selection of bolts and spent bullet casings. These items are commonly used by stalkers as a cost-effective method for navigating and triggering anomalies safely. The pack includes 20 to 30 pieces, providing ample supply for prolonged expeditions. Despite their simple design, these throwables are crucial for maintaining safety in the unpredictable environments of the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] utility item

Swiss Knife
A versatile and elegant Swiss knife, widely used for its utility and reliability. This multi-tool is equipped with a number of blades and implements that may be be used for weapon and outfit repairs. Its compact design allows for easy carrying and accessibility. The stainless steel construction ensures longevity and resistance to corrosion, making it a valuable asset in the Zone. Even though highly portable, its small size limits its effectiveness for larger scale tasks and proper workshop tools are recommended for disassembly and c crafting tasks.

Lead-lined Metal Container
The LLMC is a robust metal containment device with thick lead-lined walls and foam inserts, designed to transport anomalous formations safely within the Zone. It features a heavy, pressure-sealing lid that ensures a secure closure, preventing any radiation leakage. The lead lining is crucial as it effectively blocks all forms of radiation, safeguarding the user from potential exposure to hazardous materials. This is particularly important in the Zone where artefacts can emit harmful levels of radiation, posing serious health risks.
 
 Its design takes cues from similar containers used in the storage and transport of radioactive materials outside the Zone. Lead is a preferred material for radiation shielding due to its high density. It is commonly used in the construction of containers for radioactive waste and medical isotopes, ensuring that radiation is contained and does not pose a threat to handlers. However, an LLMC cannot be attached to a belt, meaning users cannot benefit from any potential positive properties of artefacts while they are stored within. 
 
 The LLMC is an extremely common choice for basic storage and transport and provides high shielding for its weight profile. Artefacts must be removed from the container prior to use or sale.
